genshinstrument.genshin_disclaimer.title: Disclaimer!
genshinstrument.genshin_disclaimer.conte:
Genshin Instruments is an %s and %s Minecraft mod that is in no way afiliated with Genshin Impact nor HoYoverse.

Thus, all assets used in-game, such as sounds, images, instrumens and more are of complete ownership to HoYoverse.

As the user, you have the full responsibility over your actions within the game, including (but not limited to!) playing and sharing/publishing any songs that may be protected by copyright laws.
Legal stuff aside; I hope you enjoy playing with this mod!
button.genshinstrument.audioChannels.ste:
NOTICE: Because of some annoying specification by OpenAL, all sounds produced on Stereo will be stuck on 100%.
This includes some instruments.
button.genshinstrument.audioChannels.mix:
If the Instruments sound category is set to 100%, you will hear intruments on Stereo within %s blocks of range.
Otherwise, you will hear Mono.
button.genshinstrument.stop_music_on_pla: When you or other players within %s blocks of range play an instrument, Minecraft's background music will stop.
button.genshinstrument.shared_instrument: See what other notes players nearby are playing in your instrument's screen
button.genshinstrument.accurate_accident: When on, provides a pitch-accurate representation of the accidentals used by this instrument's layout
button.genshinstrument.label: Note Labels Type
genshinstrument.advancements.main.root.d: Though wine may not be by your side, the instruments will always walk you through the Game of Freedom.
genshinstrument.advancements.main.master: Have all instruments in your inventory at once
